Content.Text:
<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'm asking why you felt it was necessary to do
something like that.

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Why? It should be obvious to anyone with a lick
of common sense! How dare you--

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
O-oh. Good evening, <MYNAME>. Is there
something you need?

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's quite all right, <MYNAME>. In fact, you came
at a good time. Do you think you could spare a
minute or two?

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Hold it! This is a private matter. It's nothing that
should concern <MYNAME>!

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Trying to talk it over with you has gotten us
nowhere. I'd like to hear an opinion from
someone who wasn't involved.
<PAGE>
<MYNAME>, I realize I'm imposing on you, but
you showing up when you did might've been
fortuitous.
<PAGE>
I'd like you to hear us out.

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hmph! If you insist on going through with this,
let me at least start.
<PAGE>
<MYNAME>, if you saw a spider in your house--
an enormous spider!--what would you do?

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You would do everything you could to get rid of
it, correct?

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_ANGRY>
Would you please not bombard <MYNAME> with
questions yet? This isn't an interrogation. Let's
each tell our side of the story first.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh! Wait, please! I'm sorry. I didn't mean to
sound so upset. I still want you to listen.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
It won't take much of your time, I promise.
Please, let's all calm down and have a proper
discussion.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Thank you. Now, let me bring you up to speed.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
You see, earlier today, we found a spider in the
house.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
My wife, fixed on flattening it, chased it around
the house with a broom.

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Anybody with an ounce of sense would have
done the same, had they seen that creepy
crawler on their wall!

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
What did that spider ever do to you? All it did
was wander into our house.
<PAGE>
If you had only left it be, I'm sure it would've
eventually wandered off somewhere else. No
need to chase it down with a broom.
<PAGE>
Right, <MYNAME>? Spiders are living creatures
too, just like us, or like farm animals.
<PAGE>
No one has the right to take the life of another
creature just because they don't like it.

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Please! Don't frame this as some ponderous
moral choice.
<PAGE>
A spider entered my house uninvited. All I did
was attempt to evict an unwelcome guest.
What's wrong with that?

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_ANGRY>
There was no need to charge around the house
wildly swinging that broom at the poor thing!
<PAGE>
If you had let it be, I'm sure it would've left soon
in search of better places to catch bugs.

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
I cannot tolerate being in the same room as a
disgusting spider. Not even for one second!
<PAGE>
Insects may not perturb you, but you know how
they rile me up!
<PAGE>
<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_ANGRY>Then you could've just caught it and released it
outside!
<PAGE>
<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>If I could have, I would have!

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I knew it! There's simply no reasoning with you!
<MYNAME>, my point of view is perfectly
normal, right?
<PAGE>
<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>Since you insisted on it, we'll let <MYNAME>
decide which of us is right!

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Though, it's obvious to anyone that my actions
were perfectly sensible.
Jonas is right.
Margot is right.
Both are right.

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
What? Are you in your right mind?! I cannot
believe you'd tolerate having one of those
skittering arachnids in your home!

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Thank you, <MYNAME>, for embracing a
sensible point of view.
<PAGE>
It's such a simple, obvious thing, but my wife's
judgment is clouded on this point, as you've
seen.
<PAGE>
I'll continue talking with her, and hopefully she'll
come around. Thank you very much for your
help. We greatly appreciate it.

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
See? It's obvious. Any normal person with an
ounce of sense would want to be rid of such a
hideous thing.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, thank you for giving your honest
opinion.
<PAGE>
However, I still don't believe my point of view is
wrong.
<PAGE>
I intend to teach my son that even the smallest
lives are precious and should be treated with
respect.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Thank you for your time. We both really
appreciate it.

<FACE_MARGOT><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Wait a minute! We're asking whether you support
killing the spider or letting it go free. How can
both viewpoints be right at the same time?

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, I must admit, I'm disappointed.
<PAGE>
You were probably hoping not to fan the flames
here, but I'm afraid a non-answer leaves us right
where we began.
<PAGE>
Thanks for your time, though. I appreciate you
hearing us out.
